poem:
### The View from Minnesota

This morning, the air is thick  
with whispers of the powerful,  
a senator lifts her voice, calling  
out to the common ledger of work.  
Inside the newspapers' thin pages,  
names rhyme with ambition—  
but alongside them, echo  
the steady clatter of honest hands.
